blog.name: naomimakesart
blog.title: My Artistic Domain
blog.description:
Naomi | She/Her | 24 | 🌞♉️| 🌜♑️| INFP | Hobbyist & Freelancer | Movie-Buff | Loves Critical Role, DnD, Tolkien, Game of Thrones| Gryffindor| TARGARYEN LOYALIST| This is my art blog! Sometimes I post original drawings, but this is all mostly fanart.
Please do NOT use, repost/copy/reproduce/trace, color, edit, publish, or distribute my art!

summary:
“Remember who you are, Daenerys, … The dragons know. Do you?”

  For my final #TargaryenThursdays I saved the best for last, the...
caption:
“Remember who you are, Daenerys, … The dragons know. Do you?”

For my final #TargaryenThursdays I saved the best for last, the girl who started this all for me. Without Dany, I wouldn’t be here! I remember buying the books in 2012, a year after the first season had come out, and not having the motivation to start such a huge series. Then whilst scrolling here on tumblr, I found a gifset of this very smol girl with pale silver hair and I was so intrigued! (I started the first two seasons of Game of Thrones after that, then devoured the books and the rest is history!) 

I started this drawing in January, and then suffered a motherboard failure, and thought I wouldn’t be able to get this back because I didn’t have the money to pay for a harddrive extraction. Then last week I taught myself how to do it on Youtube, and was able to start working on it again! I’m glad I am finally able to share this with everyone, and glad I was able to honor Daenerys in this way! 

I’m hoping my girl makes it to the very end and lives to tell the tale, but regardless of what happens I am SO grateful that GRRM created such a fantastic female lead character in a fantasy series.

summary: I’m still not over Tyrion and Cersei’s scene in seventh season. It broke my heart. I really hope we’re going to get more scenes...
body: I’m still not over Tyrion and Cersei’s scene in seventh season. It broke my heart. I really hope we’re going to get more scenes between them. It was powerful.

tags: put some respect on her name
summary: people have been saying that sansa has only learnt how to be a good wife. do you agree?
question: people have been saying that sansa has only learnt how to be a good wife. do you agree?
answer:
That’s bullshit. Let me list the skills Sansa has picked and will pick over the course of the 7 book.

1) Diplomacy- only they call it courtesy. Sansa knows how to use her words to avoid enraging people, charming them into doing what she wants (in King’s Landing this was all about staying alive), and building an image of herself that ensures that she’s underestimated by everyone

2) Networking- not only does Sansa have a great knowledge of Westerosi Houses and history, she uses that knowledge to built a network of contact of people in nearly every kingdom

3) Propaganda- while characters and fans snicker about her love for songs and fairytale aesthetics, Sansa learns how they function as effective propaganda tools (when she compares them to reality, when she compares the reception between herself and Margaery by the smallfolk when they both did little for them, for example) and she often uses them to understand historical events

4) How to run a household- after Lysa’s murder, Sansa effectively steps up as both Lady of the Eyrie and her cousin’s guardian just like her mother did when Minisa died

5) How make plots and spot conspiracies- something she’s learning from Littlefinger, a man who engineered the War of the 5 Kings and plans on making a war of three queens in order to gain as much power as possible. Here she learns the importance of learning the fortunes of lords and ladies, the importance of spies, the importance of reading people so you can tell their motivations.

6) The importance of finances and debts- tied with the previous point. This is Littlefinger’s main way of gaining ‘supporters’

7) Sansa (at 13 which is….) turned Harry from a dismissive classist fuck boy to a dismissive classist fuckboy interested in her

8) Calling banners- when Sansa wins over the Vale Lord and condemns Littlefinger to death, she’ll realise that merely calling the banners isn’t enough, that you have to convince your men to fight for you

9) Sorting diplomatic quagmires- I’m 100% sure that Sansa will be the one to put the Stark succession crisis to an end by getting all the different factions to agree with one another, preventing a civil war. Out of all of her siblings, she has the diplomatic abilities to do so

10) Food relief- she’ll also be in charge of distributing the Vale’s supply of food in the North and (likely) in the South too which isn’t easy as there are millions to feed for a long period of time

11) Managing people during sieges- she’ll survive the Siege at Winterfell. Winterfell in the books is designed to survive the Others. Just like we saw in the Battle of Blackwater, Sansa will keep the morale up and will help keep people alive inside (especially if Stannis is still alive at this point. There’s so much she can learn from him)

By the time the war with the Others ends, Sansa will have gained a wealth of knowledge through experience. There’s nothing on that list that suggests she won’t be acting as a leader in her own right as opposed to a wife.

summary: [NO SPOILERS] Enjoying the slow pace and dialogue in Season 1
title: [NO SPOILERS] Enjoying the slow pace and dialogue in Season 1
body:
I don’t think there’s really any spoilers in here even if you haven’t watched the show. I just had an observation while HBO was re-showing season 1. The pacing is so slow and every scene takes its time. The dialogue between characters is full of life and detail. I was stoked to see some of my favorite characters just shoot the shit with seemingly random other characters and it really gave you a deep look into their personalities. It felt weird to watch episodes just sort of “end” without there always been a dramatic event or cliffhanger. Naturally the mood of shows change over time but it is really trippy to go all the way back and see how everything starts.



Source: https://ift.tt/2RiBr0V
